The reason for the IP change is the `InetAddress.getLocalHost().getHostAddress()` will change when your `InetAddress.addressCache.cache.xxx.value.addresses`'s first value change, and the result of `InetAddress.getLocalHost().getHostAddress()` equals your `InetAddress.addressCache.cache.xxx.value.addresses`'s first value.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29545877/83985785-080fbd00-a96d-11ea-9224-7f6ac2b5ce59.png)

The result when I turn off the network:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29545877/83985977-bca9de80-a96d-11ea-98ee-9b774826fcf1.png)

So when it returns `127.94.0.1` not `127.0.0.1`, it maybe your network env changed. 

Can you show the results of `ifconfig` on the command line of your computer and the result of the picture above when your network env changed?

Although there is little possibility of IP changes in the production environment, but I think we should compare the results of zk record and the result of `InetAddress.getLocalHost().getHostAddress()` to determine the node or maybe add some other id to confirm the node (eg. hardware address)?
